item.title: 7.1 Generating the Control Information Summary (CIS)
item.description: There are many ways a tool developer can generate the CIS. FedRAMP is developing an Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformation (XSLT) file to generate the FedRAMP CIS. When ready, FedRAMP will make this freely available to the public here: https://github.com/GSA/fedramp-automation/tree/master/dist/content/resources

item.title: 7.2 Generating the Customer Responsibility Matrix (CRM)
Appendix A- WORKING WITH COMPONENTS
item.description: NIST designed OSCAL such that a system architect can express all aspects of the system as components. A component is anything that can satisfy a control requirement. This includes hardware, software, services, and underlying service providers, as well as policies, plans, and procedures. There are several ways to use components in an OSCAL-based SSP. The following defines FedRAMP's minimum initial use. This section will likely be updated as NIST continues to evolve its approach to components in OSCAL, and as FedRAMP receives feedback from stakeholders.

item.title: APPENDIX B- CONVERTING A LEGACY SSP TO OSCAL
item.description: NIST designed OSCAL such that a system architect can express all aspects of the system as components. A component is anything that can satisfy a control requirement. This includes hardware, software, services, and underlying service providers, as well as policies, plans, and procedures. OSCAL is also designed to support legacy conversion of SSPs without individual components defined, and enables an SSP author to migrate to the component approach gradually over time.
